  "tickets": [
    {
      "id": 10672,
      "zid": "4341",
      "subject": "After upgrade to 1.66 there are lots of errors in the log file",
      "description": "description here",
      "created_at": "2025-04-04T18:56:04Z",
      "updated_at": "2025-04-10T15:52:59Z",
      "support_level": "enterprise_edition",
      "severity": "medium",
      "impacted_environment": "dev",
      "slack_thread": "https://theappsmith.slack.com/archives/C0341RERY4R/p1744034455972609",
      "issue_context": "no-context",
      "appsmith_version": "1.62",
      "issue_type": "configuration_issue, product_issue",
      "feature_tags": "gh_devops_pod",
      "issue_summary": "he user, Harish Venkateshagowda, reported issues after upgrading the Appsmith application from version 1.19 to 1.62. The error logs indicate a problem with an invalid peer certificate and a permission denied error during configuration updates. The issue involves HTTP proxy and SSL certificate settings, which may be affecting the connection and security checks. Harish confirmed that the SSL certificates are installed on their servers, and the proxy configurations point to the correct URLs. A complete set of logs has been shared with the support team to facilitate further analysis.",
      "resolution": "N/A",
      "status": "Pending on L2",
      "requester_name": "Harish Venkateshagowda",
      "requester_email": "harish.nulugummanahalli.venkateshagowda@sunlife.com",
      "org_id": null,
      "origin": "ZENDESK",
      "product_area": "Environments",
      "isdailyreported": true,
      "l2owner": null,
      "first_response_time": 6,
      "resolution_time": null,
      "internal_first_response_time": null,
      "internal_resolution_time": null,
      "pendingcall": false,
      "isblocked": false,
      "ai_product_type": null,
      "ai_issue_type": null,
      "ai_issue_context": null,
      "ai_satisfaction_score": null,
      "related_features": "SSL Certificate Management, Proxy Configuration, Appsmith Version Upgrade",
      "requester_domain": null,
      "github_issues": null

      "issue_summary": "This user is unable to change git branches post-update to 1.66 from 1.19.       "issue_summary": "The BE user updated from v1.28 to v1.66 and is facing issues related to git and packages:\n- When discarding changes, they get the error `Unable to import artifact in workspace`, `Executor error during find command::caused by:: operaion was interrputed because the transaction exceeded the configured 'transactionLifetimeLimitSecods' on server localhost:27017`.\n- When creating new branches, they get the error `Unable to import artifact in workspace`\n- Package references are lost after the update. They get the message `Something went wrong while updating package reference`",

    {
      "id": 10704,
      "zid": "4347",
      "subject": "Re: [Bug]: Buttons are sometimes displayed incorrectly in Chrome and EDGE #39671",
      "description": "description here",
      "created_at": "2025-04-06T19:19:29Z",
      "updated_at": "2025-04-10T11:42:47Z",
      "support_level": "enterprise_edition",
      "severity": "medium",
      "impacted_environment": "prod",
      "slack_thread": "https://theappsmith.slack.com/archives/C0341RERY4R/p1744022935019749",
      "issue_context": "during_app_use",
      "appsmith_version": "1.64",
      "issue_type": "product_issue",
      "feature_tags": "gh_button_widget",
      "issue_summary": "The user is facing two intermittent issues in two different apps, and they think they might be related due to JS not being interpreted correctly in Chrome and Edge browsers.\n1. Sometimes buttons are not rendering correctly. It happens intermittently and gets fixed after clearing the cache. The issue can be temporarily resolved by clearing the Chrome cache, but it reappears after 2-3 days.\n\n2. In widgets, the raw JS code is displayed instead of evaluated values. This happens intermittently, too. They say they did a merge from staging to master in GitHub and updated the code in Appsmith using DevOps, and they were in the application during this process. The issue persists after closing and reopening Chrome. However, clearing the cache fixes it temporarily. A similar issue was reported previously here, but no solution was provided yet: https://theappsmith.slack.com/archives/C0341RERY4R/p1739804631759909\n\nThe user has not been able to consistently reproduce these issues.\n\nSimilar issue: https://theappsmith.slack.com/archives/C0341RERY4R/p1739804631759909",
      "resolution": "N/A",
      "status": "Pending on L2",
      "requester_name": "Daniel Leuenberger",
      "requester_email": "daniel.leuenberger@ehv.ch",
      "org_id": 2133,
      "origin": "ZENDESK",
      "product_area": "Widgets, Editor Linting / Evaluations / Debugger",
      "isdailyreported": null,
      "l2owner": null,
      "first_response_time": 17,
      "resolution_time": null,
      "internal_first_response_time": null,
      "internal_resolution_time": null,
      "pendingcall": true,
      "isblocked": false,
      "ai_product_type": null,
      "ai_issue_type": null,
      "ai_issue_context": null,
      "ai_satisfaction_score": null,
      "related_features": "Chrome and Edge compatibility, JS error handling, Cache management",
      "requester_domain": null,
      "github_issues": null
    },
